user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap:
```c
static void metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap(struct linux_bus *lbus,
				    struct linux_device *ldev,
				    uint32_t dir,
				    struct metal_sg *sg,
				    int nents)
{
	(void) lbus;
	(void) ldev;
	(void) dir;
	(void) sg;
	(void) nents;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_uio_dev_dma_unmap:
struct linux_bus {
	struct metal_bus	bus;
	const char		*bus_name;
	struct linux_driver	drivers[MAX_DRIVERS];
	struct sysfs_bus	*sbus;
}
...
struct linux_device {
	struct metal_device		device;
	char				dev_name[PATH_MAX];
	char				dev_path[PATH_MAX];
	char				cls_path[PATH_MAX];
	metal_phys_addr_t		region_phys[METAL_MAX_DEVICE_REGIONS];
	struct linux_driver		*ldrv;
	struct sysfs_device		*sdev;
	struct sysfs_attribute		*override;
	int				fd;
}
...
struct metal_sg {
	void *virt; /**< CPU virtual address */
	struct metal_io_region *io; /**< IO region */
	int len; /**< length */
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
struct linux_bus {
	struct metal_bus	bus;
	const char		*bus_name;
	struct linux_driver	drivers[MAX_DRIVERS];
	struct sysfs_bus	*sbus;
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The struct has two pointer members: 'const char *bus_name' (already const-qualified) and 'struct sysfs_bus *sbus' (not const). As presented there is no evidence that 'sbus' must be modified through this pointer, so no definite violation can be concluded from this fragment alone. A concrete violation would be: if 'sbus' only refers to read-only sysfs_bus data (never modified via this pointer), it should be declared as 'const struct sysfs_bus *sbus;'; leaving it non-const in that case would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
